definition: to pile up/to heap up/a mass/pile/heap/stack/large amount
rampart/base (in baseball)/to build with stones, bricks etc

sentences.english: Hezekiah asked the priests and Levites about the heaps;
sentences.chinese: 希西家向祭司，利未人查问这堆垒。

sentences.english: Then Hezekiah questioned with the priests and the Levites concerning the heaps.
sentences.chinese: 希西家向祭司，利未人查问这堆垒。

sentences.english: To check when the whole field is stacked.
sentences.chinese: 等到全部堆垒完，我要再来看看。

sentences.english: Most of the wheat & barley now cut & stacked.
sentences.chinese: 大部分小麦和大麦都在收割堆垒。

definition: to build a structure out of layered bricks or stones
lit. to pile up (bricks)/to pack/fig. to pad out (writing with fancy phrases)/ornate rhetoric
rampart/base (in baseball)/to build with stones, bricks etc
to pile up/to put layer upon layer/(Tw) (computing) stack
to build by laying bricks or stones
